author: Q U A S A R
title: These Walled Gardens - DevThemePark
description: We live/operate in physical/digital silos that limit the flow in and out of social groups and devs need a fast track lane to teams/tools.

assessments.note: Interesting idea and willingness to work with other proposers but what is actually being proposed... I don't know.
Not clear how this addresses the challenge

I think is a great idea to harness the community with different experiences and integrate passions with a focused centered approach on resolving challenges that may be required but are not well equipped or resourced to handle the work involve to do it right. More information or perhaps clear metrics as to the platform needed to make it work, management and changes needed to be implemented to make this work.

This proposal is lacking all of the technical documentation, description of protocol components, benchmarking to current/upcoming dev platforms for Cardano newcomers and any notion of a budget describing work activity.
This proposal is greatly lacking detail and reads like one of the several developer hub platforms already in development.
No clear picture of how this proposal will attract or create a favourable eco-system for developers, Idea looks so broad

The proposals describe interesting tool for attracting and educating new developers. In my understanding the challenge of attracting new developers is separate from the task of improving the experience of existing of existing developers. While the scope of this proposal falls close to the aim of "developer ecosystem" challenge it does not address it directly. Therefore, the proposals that fall closer to the aim of the challenge should be prioritized. The improved version of this proposal would be a valuable contribution for future challenges.
Too vague to judge. Also, not very professional to suggest people should bypass the voting process and directly send you ADA.

The first paragraph of the plan is describing the challenge icon and asking for funds via independent link. Basically there is no plan presented and it's not clear what experience the proposer has to implement the idea

Not enough information regarding the experience needed to drive the performance required for a successful implementation of the proposal. But I can see the idea being something needed to polish the way ideas are presented to the voting members of the community. It can substantially create confidence in the results with such a system in place.

This proposal is missing the basic documentation, development roadmap, budget breakdown and other details required to have a chance at successful implementation. it's never made clear how this will be any different than the Dev ecosystem/onboarding tools already in development from the community/CF.
There is no detailed project plan, budget, benchmark or metrics included. this is an early concept stage idea
A lot of things mentioned in the proposal like educating, certification, onboarding doesn't explain or doesn't look feasible how they'll get implemented

The proposal presents unique and valuable approach to the developing the cardano ecosystem. The chosen approach to the problem is the biggest strength and weakness of the proposal. More detailed description of the approach is needed to convince the voters of feasibility and value of the proposal. The proposal would benefit greatly from additions of the visual material and examples of the approach. Timeline with the concrete deliverables and definition of success is also desired. Identified links to other proposals definitely add strength to the proposal but without more detailed plans evaluating the benefits of this links is difficult.
Echoing what has been written in the comments, unclear how the funding would be spent.
No roadmaps or milestones are presented, no indication on what the budget will be used for, no description of success criteria

More clarity in regards of the track record for the project is? what are the steps needed to get there? any onboarding developers part of the proposals?  or key metrics to show the steps required to get there.

Proposals with little to no documentation should complete a project roadmap, technical docs that describe how this dev ecosystem will function in depth and highlight the metrics/benchmarks you are using to arrive there. This proposal includes none of that.
all of the required information to effectively address the challenge is missing
The idea provided is very broad and doesn't go into the specifics like what would be the starting poing, how the funds will be used effectively
Better defined vision of the end product is needed to evaluate feasibility. The proposal provides good introduction to the approach, but specific detail is necessary.

solution: Create a contextual microcosmic space to onboard devs and show the way to the playground. The Garden the self-identification center to zoo.
experience: Independent Scholar with a focus on social networks, linguistics, and ideaflow.
